revised_title: Palaeomagnetic Survey of South American Rock Formations: Unraveling the Geomagnetic History of Peru
tldr: A palaeomagnetic survey of South American rock formations in Peru reveals that the Pennsylvanian Ambo Group and the Permo-Triassic Mitu Group were originally magnetized and then partly remagnetized after folding during the Tertiary or Recent epochs. The study provides insights into the geomagnetic history of the region and the complex palaeomagnetic record created by the Andean mountain building movements.
